alert.note: Alert for Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:31AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Norton and northern Graham Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 231 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Prairie View to 7 miles southwest of Edmond. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Norton and northern Graham Counties, including the following locations... Densmore and Calvert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
